result.execSummary:
The defendant Brendon A McCord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 2 days were granted if revoked.  May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be Held Open. State to consider.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

No Contact with co-actors. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brendon A McCord in court, in custody, with Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guity plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements.  Bruce P. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION: 18 MONTHS  (2 days credit, if revoked)  **transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actors
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done

RESTITUTION:  Held open - state to check into (Note: restitution was ordered on Co-Def's case as joint and several) 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($1,000.00) - remainder to be returned to poster)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days straight time - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

**Expunction request is denied**

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
